# NSW Vaccination numbers and statistics
```{r Plotdata, include=FALSE}
library(dplyr)
library(tidyverse)
library(plotly)
library(ggplot2)
library(scales)
library(RColorBrewer)
library(gridExtra)
library(ggthemes)
library(highcharter)
library(DT)
library(leaflet)

setwd("C:/Users/32631/Documents/Rstudio/R_A3")

vac <- read.csv("NSW-vaccinated.csv")


```

The table below shows the NSW vaccination numbers and statistics.

Tips! If you are a resident of NSW, you can use the empty box below to check the vaccination rate.
```{r NSW-vac, echo=FALSE}
vac %>%
  datatable(rownames = FALSE,
            filter = list(position = 'top'))
```
